data.title: Editor crashed when using msaa x16
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
windows 10 (hd7850)
OS X (Intel(R) Iris(TM) Graphics 6100)

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
The editor crashes when setting the project settings to rendering>quality>msaa = x16 as soon as you open the 3d viewport.

data.title: NativeScript changes and OS symbol lookup optional error handling
data.body:
## [NativeScript] call _init on instance creation

This also adds basic locking for the set of owners
to avoid threading problems

## added an optional parameter to OS symbol lookup

When looking up a symbol from a library, previously an error was
shown when the symbol did not exist. That caused confusion when the
lookup was completely optional.
This adds a new parameter to that method so that those errors can
be handled manually if needed.


data.title: Support MSVC (2015) build tools
data.body:
The Godot 2.x branch is in an odd place in terms of MSVC and Visual Studio.  Godot 2.x doesn't currently support Visual Studio 2017 and Microsoft no longer offers Visual Studio 2015 for download unless you're a Visual Studio subscriber.

However, as usual, Microsoft does provide the compiler and other [build tools for VS2015](http://landinghub.visualstudio.com/visual-cpp-build-tools) for free, just without VS itself.  Godot's current build scripts however, for whatever reason, check for Visual Studio rather than the presence of the MSVC compiler tool chain.  This PR fixes that.  A similar fix is likely to be required for the master branch.

EDIT:  Apparently VS2015 is available as part of the free tier of the Visual Studio subscription.  That makes this PR less critical, but it's still worth merging for those that need to target earlier MSVC tool chains without having the associated release of VS installed as well.

data.title: Unable to access instanced scene menu options on an instanced inherited scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 3.0 Alpha 1

**Issue description:**
If a scene is inherited from one scene and is instanced in another scene, there will be no options to discard instancing (only clear inheritance), or to make children editable, or to load the instance as a placeholder.

[Screenshot of menu with instanced scene](http://i.imgur.com/JASWcX5.png)
[Screenshot of menu with instanced inherited scene](http://i.imgur.com/MaszPV7.png)

data.title: Height fog turns itself on
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits

I restarted Godot a few times now without saving my scene, and I noticed that the height fog turns itself on randomly when I load the main scene. Sometimes it does, sometimes it doesnt. Maybe related to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/9898.
`fog_height_enabled = false` in the .tscn, but it still shows as enabled in the scene.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28650045-47ad6274-7279-11e7-8e3f-f73dc6ded6b5.png)

Project: 
[Test3.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1178454/Test3.zip)

data.title: Boolean property says "activated" but the checkbox isn't
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits, language french

The checkbox here isn't ticked, but the label says "activated" in french. Checking or unchecking doesn't change the label.

data.title: Freelook shortcuts don't appear until they are used
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits

Shortcuts appear only if I USE freelook at least once during the session, and if I set them different keys they are taken into account. They disappear again in further sessions, but seem to remember what they were set to, and remain hidden until the keys get used.

Reason why: they are used on the fly unlike "retained" shortcuts but I forgot to initialize them properly. woops

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28649207-6bb4ca32-7273-11e7-8ca9-1988b14f0bac.png)

data.title: All projects are "Unnamed project", even though they do have a name
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits

The project manager shows "Unnamed project" on all projects, but when I open project settings I can see a name (which is obviously not "Unnamed project"):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28648795-bdf9aad6-7270-11e7-8b0c-9118f6685f89.png)

Opening a project also doesn't open the main scene, I think it used to do that before. Maybe there is an issue with the parsing of config files in the project manager?

The config file for the one under `/Test3`:

```
config_version=3

[application]

name="Test3"
main_scene="res://main.tscn"
icon="res://icon.png"

[display]

stretch/mode="viewport"

[memory]

multithread/thread_rid_pool_prealloc=60

[rendering]

viewport/default_clear_color=Color( 0.407806, 0.628906, 0.618542, 1 )
shadows/directional_shadow_size=4096
```

data.title: Sometimes resource thumbnails are shown in inspector, sometimes not
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits

I noticed that I have no preview of the resources being in use here, I see there names now:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28648625-61b0846c-726f-11e7-8c12-329913f40703.png)

On the other hand, if I click on another MeshInstance in the same scene, I see thumbnails:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28648641-87f2cb44-726f-11e7-8a73-b87bdee3735b.png)

I used to see thumbnails in the first one a bit earlier in the same session, in which materials where black balls instead of brown. Not sure what caused them to disappear.
#9891 did occur earlier in the session, but I realize that now I can click on meshes without it happening, so maybe it's related?

Edit: I closed another unsaved scene, and now I can see thumbnails again in the first MeshInstance, and material thumbnails are back to brown color:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28648765-5effa3c8-7270-11e7-9983-dc810031a017.png)

Clicking on a mesh resource breaks the main viewport
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits

I clicked on the `mesh` property of a MeshInstance, and the main viewport became black with a thumbnail of the mesh rendered on the bottom left:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28647955-a1002fbe-726a-11e7-9b61-37dfddcbb284.png)

It stays like that even if I go back to another node or close the scene and reopen it, though if I select another mesh it changes too in the main viewport.
If I have no 3D scene open and switch to 3D, I see the thumbnail in full size:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28648029-188f254e-726b-11e7-8f54-918fde717656.png)

Seeeee I found a bug

data.title: The mouse gets locked when dragging a number field
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits

I dragged the bloom intensity property, and my mouse got immediately stuck at the middle of the screen. It started to warp there showing a red icon, then it disappeared when I released the button. I tabbed out of Godot, then focused it again, and I could see my mouse warping at the center everytime I try to move it.
Then I was able to get back the mouse by clicking again.

Note 1: dragging didn't affect the property at all, it took the first "pixel" of movement (going from 1.0 to 1.1) but not more.

Note 2: it seems it doen't happen all the time.

Looks like another occurence of #7098.

data.title: Control node enhancements
data.body:
API changes:
- [x] Replace anchor mode by a float between 0 and 1. By now, it stay modifiable through an enum property, and the ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END and ANCHOR_CENTER are kept as constant. Basically it does not deeply changes the API or the workflow, but it stores the anchor as a float value. (This is the base for other enhancements)
- [x] The margin are now always a vector2 relative to the anchor position, it does not changes sign when it has a value like ANCHOR_CENTER or ANCHOR_END (>=0.5). This means that inner margins on the bottom and right side (with ANCHOR_CENTER or ANCHOR_END anchor) have usually negative values. It explains the first commit size.

Editor:
- [x] Anchor visualization,
- [x] Draggable anchors,
- [x] Automatically snapping anchors depending on the zoom level.
- [x] Draw anchors lines when dragged, which are then colored when snapped.
- [x] display percentage when draggin anchors.
- [x] snap anchors one to each other.
- [x] drag several anchors at the same time.
- [x] Avoid left anchor to over right

Abandoned:
~~highlight the side related to the dragged anchor~~ (I finally think this is useless, but the link beween anchors and the control sides could be made when moving control nodes, with a display of the margins values when dragging it)

Demo:
![output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6093119/28989639-fe1afc2a-7976-11e7-80cb-fa8d0d70bcc1.gif)

(the green pins are anchors, sorry I could not capture the mouse)

Any other ideas ? What do you think ?

**Link to minimal example project:**
Current material demo ( https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects/commit/9365e97c0f6cb3dc9c355d6d6e03988a1230b871 )

data.title: Fix power management on x11 platform and removes explicit NULL pointer dereference
data.body:
This PR fixes calls to power management on X11 which caused a crash of the running game.
Also removes explicit NULL pointer dereferences which I previously forgot because of the translation from SDL (C) to Godot. Thanks @Marqin for pointing out.

data.title: Fix $a/b being parsed as division
data.body: As reported by @kubecz3k on IRC.

data.title: Forward refcount changes to NativeScriptInstance
data.body:
This also changes Reference::unreference() to always invoke
refcount_decremented. Previously it was not invoked until the count
reached zero due to short-circuit evalution of boolean expressions.

data.title: added use_alpha so that drawing tranparent color is possible
data.body:
@dumitru-stama maybe there is a better way?

closes #9811

data.title: [LineEdit] [Android] Maybe a regression 2.1.2 -> 2.1.3 in Android export template for the LineEdit node when using predictive keyboard and select_all.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
It works in Godot 2.1.2 (with 2.1.2 templates) exported to Android, but not in 2.1.3. The export is done on Linux 64 bit.

**Issue description:**
When the LineEdit node has some text and it's selected with select_all(), then the expected behavior is that that text is cleared on backspace or when typing. This works fine in 2.1.2 on Android with a predictive keyboard.

But in 2.1.3 what happens is that with a predictive keyboard only one character is removed with backspace (while the entire text is selected) or characters are appended to the current text with typing. Also when there are two words and they are both selected (with select_all()) and backspace is pressed, the first word is deleted and 1 character is removed from the second word.

data.title: Fix mutating project.godot
data.body:
Namely:
- comment block lost on first save;
- `config_version` doubled as 3 and null on second save;
- format change on first save.

## Concerns

- Without the added `p_merge_with_current` parameter set to `false`, the initial settings would have properties for display width and height. that would go away on first save. I can't think of any bad side effect of this new flag, but can't be sure it hasn't either.
- This will have the top comment block added for project export as well. But that's not a problem provided it will eventually get converted to binary, is it?
- Also code is added to make the order of the properties be the same between the first and second saves. That wasn't happening with the hard-coded settings, but this one introduces that to ensure the same order on both code paths. May this break something?

## Before

- Initial content:

```
; Engine configuration file.
; It's best edited using the editor UI and not directly,
; since the parameters that go here are not all obvious.
; 
; Format: 
;   [section] ; section goes between []
;   param=value ; assign values to parameters


[application]


config/name="Awesome game"
config/icon="res://icon.png"
[rendering]
environment/default_environment="res://default_env.tres"
```

- After changing settings for the first time (__comment gone, format changes__):

```
config_version=3

[application]

config/name="Awesome game"
config/icon="res://icon.png"

[rendering]

environment/default_environment="res://default_env.tres"
```

- After reloading project and changing settings again (__spurious null-valued `config_version`__):

```
config_version=3

config_version=null

[application]

config/name="Awesome game"
config/icon="res://icon.png"

[rendering]

environment/default_environment="res://default_env.tres"
```

## After

Always the same:

```
; Engine configuration file.
; It's best edited using the editor UI and not directly,
; since the parameters that go here are not all obvious.
; 
; Format: 
;   [section] ; section goes between []
;   param=value ; assign values to parameters

config_version=3

[application]

config/name="Awesome game"
config/icon="res://icon.png"

[rendering]

environment/default_environment="res://default_env.tres"
```
